intro: Grumilea adenophylla, commonly known as the silver-leafed grumia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant has hairy, silver-green leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
